Notes: System model considered for sampling, quantizing and encoding an OU process at the transmitter, and reconstructing it at the receiver.
Quantization and Coding of the OU Process
Note that the OU process is no longer Markov after quantization.

Example sample path during the $i$th epoch using the enhanced IIR scheme when $\beta\leq T_b$. In this example $r_i=2$, and so the third IR bit is non-used and its remaining portion is cut off to start a new epoch. Red crosses denote failed decoding attempts and the green circle denotes success.

Example sample path during the $i$th epoch using the enhanced IIR scheme when $\beta\leq T_b$. In this example $r_i=2$, and so the third IR bit is non-used and its remaining portion is cut off to start a new epoch. Red crosses denote failed decoding attempts and the green circle denotes success.

Example sample path during the $i$th epoch using the enhanced IIR scheme when $\beta\leq T_b$. In this example $r_i=2$, and so the third IR bit is non-used and its remaining portion is cut off to start a new epoch. Red crosses denote failed decoding attempts and the green circle denotes success.

Example sample path during the $i$th epoch using the enhanced IIR scheme when $\beta>T_b$. In this example $r_i=2$ and $\beta=1.5T_b$, and so the final two IR bits are non-used and the remaining bit portion is cut off to start a new epoch. Red crosses denote failed decoding attempts and the green circle denotes success.

Example sample path during the $i$th epoch using the enhanced IIR scheme when $\beta>T_b$. In this example $r_i=2$ and $\beta=1.5T_b$, and so the final two IR bits are non-used and the remaining bit portion is cut off to start a new epoch. Red crosses denote failed decoding attempts and the green circle denotes success.

Example sample path during the $i$th epoch using the enhanced IIR scheme when $\beta>T_b$. In this example $r_i=2$ and $\beta=1.5T_b$, and so the final two IR bits are non-used and the remaining bit portion is cut off to start a new epoch. Red crosses denote failed decoding attempts and the green circle denotes success.

Example sample path during an epoch using the enhanced FR scheme when $\beta\leq nT_b$. In this example $M=2$, and so it takes two transmissions to succeed. The red cross denotes a failed decoding attempt and green circles denote success.

Example sample path during an epoch using the enhanced FR scheme when $\beta\leq nT_b$. In this example $M=2$, and so it takes two transmissions to succeed. The red cross denotes a failed decoding attempt and green circles denote success.

Example sample path during an epoch using the enhanced FR scheme when $\beta\leq nT_b$. In this example $M=2$, and so it takes two transmissions to succeed. The red cross denotes a failed decoding attempt and green circles denote success.

Example sample path during an epoch using the enhanced FR scheme when $\beta>nT_b$. In this example $M=2$, and so it takes two transmissions to succeed. Light-red boxes represent the lower bound on $\delta$ (idle times). The red cross denotes a failed decoding attempt and green circles denote success.

Example sample path during an epoch using the enhanced FR scheme when $\beta>nT_b$. In this example $M=2$, and so it takes two transmissions to succeed. Light-red boxes represent the lower bound on $\delta$ (idle times). The red cross denotes a failed decoding attempt and green circles denote success.
